mod_name.label: Mod name
mod_name.description: The name of your mod (cannot easily change later)

author.label: Author
author.description: Use your Steam username for automatic linking of mod to profile (can change later in About-Release.xml)

in_game_description.label: Mod Description
in_game_description.description: The description of the mod as it appears in-game (can change later in About-Release.xml)

mod_ver.label: Mod Version
mod_ver.description: The version of Rimworld this mod is for (default:1.0)

create_empty_definitions.label: Create blank XML definition files
create_empty_definitions.description: Create empty files as templates for your definitions

harmony.label: Include Harmony library
harmony.description: A useful library to safely patch game code. Include it here, unless your mod will depend on HugsLib, or doesn't need to patch.

helloWorld.label: Log Hello World on start
helloWorld.description: A sample so you know your mod is loaded: Do delete this later.

settings.label: Mod Settings
settings.description: Include extra code and files to use built-in Mod Settings

debugLog.label: Log.Message Debug only
debugLog.description: This mod defines its own Log.Message, so Logging uses that instead of Verse.Log.Message. This method is disabled in release builds, so you can keep Log.Message in code, and it never spams users

defOfWarn.label: Suppress DefOf warning
defOfWarn.description: The game checks and warns if 'DefOf' classes are used before they are initialized, but some Harmony patches cause it to think they are used, when they are merely referenced in a patch.
